alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 3:58PM EDT until June 16 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Lunenburg County in south central Virginia... Southeastern Nottoway County in south central Virginia... Central Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... Northern Brunswick County in south central Virginia... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 358 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Blackstone, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Fort Barfoot around 405 PM EDT. Wilsons around 410 PM EDT. McKenney around 430 PM EDT. Dewitt around 435 PM EDT. Dinwiddie around 440 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include North Wellville, Irby, Rawlings, Barrows Store, Murdocks, Forkland, Warfield, Wharfs Store, Darvills and Ordsburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
